channel.title: Commands Question?
channel.description:
Can Someone Tell Me How To Make A "Pickup" Or/ "Item" Command So I Can Spawn Items.. Cus I Got A Source That I Wanna Work On.. But I Can't Spawn My Items That I Coded..
-Ty Already.
Peace Out.

item.title: Commands Question?
item.dc:creator: @staypuff staypuff
item.description:
@staypuff wrote:

[quote=“nubers, post:11, topic:365721”][quote author=staypuff link=topic=461921.msg3379498#msg3379498 date=1287907425]

If you are getting a new source because you can’t fix this problem, you shouldn’t even waste your time coding or C&P-ing in your case.
[/quote]

well he has to start somewere, let him get it wrong till he gets it right… no need to say that crap, just makes people feel bad…[/quote]

A start would be learning how to fix the common 100 error problem. How would any one learn anything if when they ran into problems, they ditched their work and avoided the problem while having some one else provide them with a working source.

Failure is the best excuse to learn something new. As a coder, this should be taken advantage of.

Read full topic

item.title: Commands Question?
item.dc:creator: @staypuff staypuff
item.description:
@staypuff wrote:

This thread has some horrible English in it.

When you recurve 100 errors, there is a 99% chance it is due to an unmatched bracket. Basically, every “{” needs a “}”.
Example: you have 8 {'s and only 7 }'s.

Just look through your command and make sure there is a “}” for every “{”.

If you are getting a new source because you can’t fix this problem, you shouldn’t even waste your time coding or C&P-ing in your case.

Read full topic

item.title: Commands Question?
item.dc:creator: @nubers nubers
item.description:
@nubers wrote:

this should work, i think?

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pickup")) {
				try {
					if(c.playerRights <= 2){
		return;
		}
					String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
					if (args.length == 3) {
						int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
						int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
						if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
							c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);		
						} else {
							c.sendMessage("That item ID does not exist.");
						}
					} else {
						c.sendMessage("umm you did something wrong :O");
					}
				} catch(Exception e) {
					
				}

Read full topic
